climbs.name: Slickfoot holiday direct AKA Squeezin' The Juice

content.description: Start as for slickfoot holiday (the large jug about 6 feet to the right of Lovage) and climb directly up on pinches, gastons, and crimps. Finish as for Lovage.
content.location: On the Lovage boulder in upper forestland

content.description: Grab the rounded ledge, and work your way up and right to the finish of Fedge. Tall, technical v1, but pretty fun, too.
content.protection: 1-2 pads. A spotter to help you move the pad to the right as you climb up, so that your slab experience can be somewhat protected.
content.location: Middle line on this large boulder that is first encountered when you get to Upper Forestland. Left of Fedge, right of Lovage.

content.description: Take a seat, grab the big ledge, and shoot straight up to a hidden jug on the corner. Actually pretty fun. If it was taller, I'd say it would be the best line on the boulder. Definitely the best moves.
content.protection: 1-2 pads. A spotter, since there's a boulder behind and to the left.
content.location: Left side of the first big boulder you come to in Upper Forestland. Lovage starts in the little corner formed by this boulder, and the ramp-like lower angle boulder sitting behind it.

content.description: An excellent traverse that starts on the triangular crimp of Fedge and heads across the boulder, finishing on Lovage. Crux moves are getting to the starting jug of Slickfoot Holiday from some small crimps, however it gets pretty pumpy once you are pulling into Lovage.
content.location: 1st boulder on right as you enter upper Forestland.

content.description:
A somewhat intimidating problem on a big rock. One of the first lines you'll spot as you enter the magical realm of Upper Forestland.

Start on the corner with a triangular crimp and shoot straight up. Puzzle out the slab, doing your best to avoid pine needles.
content.protection: Not the best landing, if memory serves me, but not the worst either. 2-3 pads, and a good spotter.
content.location: On the downhill facing aspect of the first large boulder you come to when you get to Upper Forestland. Look for the starting triangular flake. This problem isn't always chalked.
